content: I was wondering if WG-Prioritization should have triage permissions for the rust-lang/rust repo, to be able to handle MCPs more easily (i.e. without relying on @Santiago Pastorino which is mostly the case right now).
I'd not be opposed, not sure whether @Pietro Albini has concerns (I'm not quite sure what triage perms entail). We also have the bots, in theory, that can permit folks to adjust labels and so forth?
triage permissions are fine from a security perspective
(For reference: https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/setting-up-and-managing-organizations-and-teams/repository-permission-levels-for-an-organization)

So triage perms grant:

  • Apply labels
  • Close, reopen, and assign all issues and pull requests
  • Apply milestones
  • Mark duplicate issues and pull requests
  • Request pull request reviews
Most of which are completely useless in rust-lang/compiler-team, I guess
Configuring rustbot is also a solution, though we won’t be able to close accepted MCPs
oh we're talking about compiler-team sorry
I thought you meant the main rust repo
I mean we can give stronger permissions too I think
what kind of things would it be useful to be able to do?

nikomatsakis said:

I thought you meant the main rust repo

Oops, that's my bad, I wrote rust-lang/rust earlier. Yes, I'm talking about rust-lang/compiler-team
(And btw the WG already has triage permissions in the main repo)
I think we only need to manage the to-announce and mcp-accepted labels, and close the accepted MCPs
I'm not sure stronger permissions are needed. Write permissions would allow us to edit comments but I don't think that's really useful... :shrug:
